meanings.definition: To distribute information or propaganda widely.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to circularise the new product details to all customers.
meanings.sent2: The political party plans to circularise their campaign flyers throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The rumor mill in the small town decided to circularise the gossip about the mayor's cat.
meanings.sent4: The enthusiastic teacher managed to circularise the idea of a class picnic to the students.
meanings.sent5: The internet allows us to circularise news and updates instantly to a global audience.

meanings.definition: To make something circular in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: She used a mold to circularise the dough into perfectly round cookies.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to circularise the painting by adding a circular frame.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to circularise their playdough into a ball but ended up with a square.
meanings.sent4: The architect's design aimed to circularise the building's layout for a unique look.
meanings.sent5: The potter skillfully circularised the clay into a beautiful vase on the wheel.
